cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles south of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across Cuba, then expected to turn northwest over the Gulf of Mexico toward the north-west Gulf Coast (upper Texas-south-west Louisiana shoreline)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas-south-west Louisiana coast (near the TX/LA border/Cameron, LA area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches yet along the U.S. Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: No warnings yet along the U.S. Gulf Coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-west Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast through coastal Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (and possibly hurricane-force if the track shifts west) could reach Texas City as early as late Wednesday night/early Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge of at least 3–6 ft above ground level possible along the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and Texas City dike.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rainfall totals of 4–8 inches (locally higher) possible in the Galveston Bay region with flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Coastal flooding, dangerous surf and rip currents, and possible port channel restrictions due to high water levels and wind-driven waves.
